title: Unit testing: are you making a Mock<ery>?
abstract: Refactoring and cleaning our code is a must if we want to stay productive, but when the test suite becomes flaky and constantly breaks it can quickly end up rotting in the too hard basket. This is a practical example of how to unit test the behaviours of your dotnet core WebApi in memory at its system boundaries : using less mocks, making your test suite more trust worthy and your production code a dream to maintain
